intro: Bunium flexuosum, commonly known as the flexible fennel, is a flowering plant native to Central Asia and parts of Europe. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes other aromatic plants like parsley and carrots. The plant is characterized by its finely divided, feathery leaves and small yellow flowers that appear in umbels. It thrives in dry, rocky soils and is often found in mountainous regions. Its seeds are used in traditional medicine and have a mild anise-like aroma.
